newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: REBEL SAYS ON TRACK FOR 1998 PROFIT RISE.
newsitem.headline: REBEL SAYS ON TRACK FOR 1998 PROFIT RISE.

text.p: Sporting goods retailer Rebel Sport said on Monday that it was on track to report an increased profit for the year to March 31, 1998.

Deputy chairman Ian Dresner said in a statement prepared for the annual general meeting that sales for the first four months of the current financial year were up 14.2 percent on the same period last year.
"This performance is particularly pleasing in the light of an extremely tough retail environment and of price deflation within the sporting goods retail market," Dresner said.
"Rebel Sport remains on track to record another increased profit result this financial year," he added.
Rebel in June reported a full year 1997 net profit of A$3.91 million, up 26 percent on the previous year.

Dresner said Rebel, which has 23 stores and claims seven percent of the Australian sporting goods market, planned to open two new outlets at the end of August, one in Brisbane and its first in Adelaide.
Two new superstores were also planned for Sydney and Melbourne in October and November.
